formattedAddress: 805 W 187th St, New York, NY 10040, USA
adrFormatAddress: 805 W 187th St, New York, NY 10040, USA

originalText.text: Fantastic uptown sushi restaurant with fresh, quality cuts of seafood and tasty sake. You can see the staff making fresh Ramen noodles and broth daily. There are limited seats, but don't worry as plenty of bar stools are available. Sushi platters are great value and I absolutely loved the tempura prawn roll with avocado... The perfect mix of fresh, spicy and crunchy.

text.text: Fantastic uptown sushi restaurant with fresh, quality cuts of seafood and tasty sake. You can see the staff making fresh Ramen noodles and broth daily. There are limited seats, but don't worry as plenty of bar stools are available. Sushi platters are great value and I absolutely loved the tempura prawn roll with avocado... The perfect mix of fresh, spicy and crunchy.

originalText.text:
We visited to celebrate, so as well as a little too much of the (very tasty) food, we each had a sake flight, which I would absolutely recommend doing if you'd like to discover your taste in sake, or just have an excellent experience. We got to choose from a rather random selection of cups for the sake and it was fun looking at the different ones and discovering hidden details. The three saki were not poured all at once, but in order through the meal (I saved a few sips for comparisons). We also had a pot of hot tea (genmaicha).

Food wise, we shared vegetable tempura, then I had udon soup and a pair of hand rolls. This was too much food!

Service was truly excellent, and I would absolutely recommend this place!

originalText.text:
i am a simple girl with simple needs. tampopo understands this, and yet, even the most basic of dishes (avo cucumber sushi, miso soup…even their soy sauce) are prepared with a level of care and expertise that cannot go unrecognized.

on the other hand, i appreciate the uniqueness & customizability of their noodle soups. from the types of noodles to broths and toppings, any substitutions or special requests we have made were consistently executed to perfection. i actually have lots of dietary restrictions, so a restaurant that can accommodate is always a blessing. i really don’t mind ordering the same dishes everywhere i go, but it is great to have options here.

this is one of the first spots i think of when i’m looking for a nourishing, healing meal. staff and atmosphere are equal parts peaceful and welcoming, though we usually get takeout & picnic in the park.

originalText.text: went here with my partner a few weeks back and it was such a great experience!! food is delicious, reasonably priced & the atmosphere is great!! its a lot smaller than i expected but if you want grab a quick bite of comfort food, this is definitely the spot!

text.text: went here with my partner a few weeks back and it was such a great experience!! food is delicious, reasonably priced & the atmosphere is great!! its a lot smaller than i expected but if you want grab a quick bite of comfort food, this is definitely the spot!

originalText.text:
We went twice in a week and brought the one year old baby who was messy.
Still they welcomed us.   The sushi and tempora was delicious.  We loved the rolls and saki.  The baby loved the chicken meatballs.  The server was wonderful.  It's a very small place right on main street Hudson Heights.
